business.headline: Stocks to watch today: Infosys, Tata Motors, BEL, Adani Power, HCLTech and moreMarkets are set for a strong start as key stocks like Infosys, Tata Motors, and Adani Power grab attention. Trade talks, global deals, and company moves could shape today's trading session. Here's what investors need to know.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will positive run continue on stock market?Stock market opening today: The Sensex and Nifty gained in the previous session amid reports of positive talks between Indian and US officials about a trade deal. Analysts have noted that the focus during today's trading session will be on upcoming tariff developments and the India-US trade deal outcome.
US suspends WTO financial contributions: ReportThe Trump administration has reportedly suspended financial contributions to The World Trade Organisation amid efforts to cut back government spending.
Wall Street drifts as auto tariffs hurt GM, help Tesla and othersDonald Trump's auto tariffs impacted Wall Street on Thursday morning, with autogiant General Motors falling by 6.8%.

Trump's 25% auto tariff: Which Indian companies will pay the priceUS President Donald Trump's 25% tariff on car imports will affect a few Indian companies, including Tata Motors, Eicher Motors, and Samvardhana Motherson. These firms ship components to the US and Europe's markets.

Sensex, Nifty close higher: Top gainers and losers, tariff impact and key driversStock market today: Some of the top gainers during today's session were Bajaj Finserv, IndusInd Bank, NTPC, L&T, Ultratech Cement, Hero MotoCorp, Adani Enterprises and BPCL. On the other hand, some of the top losers were Tata Motors, Sun Pharma, Eicher Motors, Apollo Hospitals, Bharti Airtel, Kotak Mahindra Bank and HCLTech.

Sensex ends 318 points higher, Nifty just below 23,600; Tata Motors down 5%Stock market closing bell: The S&P BSE Sensex ended 317.93 points higher at 77,606.43, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 105.10 points to settle at 23,591.95.

Noida, Greater Noida flat registration fees may rise 20-30%According to a draft notification, circle rates in Noida could see a 20% hike, while in Greater Noida, the increase may go up to 30%. The move is expected to make property transactions more expensive in the region.

India may receive reprieve from proposed US tariffs: SourcesIndia may escape the proposed US tariffs and avoid being grouped with nations like China, Mexico, and Canada, according to government sources. Trade talks between the two countries are progressing smoothly, with no signs of a deadlock as the April 2 deadline for US reciprocal tariffs approaches.

RBI may double foreign individual investor limit to 10% in listed firms: ReportForeign portfolio investors (FPIs), pressured by poor earnings, high valuations and prospects of U.S. tariffs, have pulled more than $28 billion out of Indian stocks since September's record high in the benchmark NSE Nifty 50.

Elon Musk leads Hurun Global Rich List despite $100 billion drop in net worthElon Musk has reretained his position as the wealthiest person in the world for the fourth time in five years, becoming the first individual to surpass the $400 billion threshold, noted the Hurun Research report.

US tariff reprieve for India, may not be treated like China, Canada, Mexico: SourcesTrade talks between the two nations are progressing smoothly, with no deadlock expected before the April 2 deadline for US reciprocal tariffs.

entertainment.headline: Empuraan box office Day 1: Mohanlal's film becomes biggest opener in MalayalamMohanlal and Prithviraj Sukumaran's L2: Empuraan opened strong at the box office. The initial trade reports suggest that the film earned Rs 22 crore nett at the domestic box office in all languages.

Veera Dheera Sooran Part 2 review: Vikram shines in a gritty slow-burn action thrillerReleased-Thu Mar 27, 2025Veera Dheera Sooran Part 2 movie review: Vikram returns with a gripping performance in a tense and slow-burning action thriller that keeps the stakes high. Directed by SU Arun Kumar, the film blends raw intensity with a grounded narrative, making for an engaging watch.

Adolescence creator Stephen Graham teases fans about Season 2Netflix's latest series Adolescence has taken the world by storm, topping charts in 80 countries. Creator Stephen Graham recently said how surprised he is by its global impact and also discussed its potential for a sequel.

Ella Langley dominates 2025 ACM nominations while Beyoncé and Miranda Lambert miss outElla Langley leads the 2025 ACM Awards nominations with eight nods, including female artist of the year. Meanwhile, Beyoncé's Cowboy Carter and Miranda Lambert's Postcards from Texas are notably absent.

Khloé Kardashian's workout routine: The secret behind her stunning transformationKhloé Kardashian's fitness journey features circuit training, high-intensity cardio, and rowing. With consistency, she transformed her body, proving that dedication, varied workouts, and discipline are key to long-term fitness.

Sikandar advance booking: Salman Khan film sees strong sales ahead of releaseSalman Khan's upcoming film, Sikandar, is already a box office sensation with advance bookings nearing Rs 10 crore. The film will release on March 30.

K-pop group NewJeans announce hiatus amid legal dispute, leave fans divided In a pivotal ruling, the Seoul Central District Court has sided with ADOR, restricting K-pop group NewJeans from pursuing independent activities. The decision follows allegations of mistreatment, which ADOR denies, sparking diverse reactions among fans.

Katrina-fication of Vaani Kapoor, says Internet on actor's recent pic. Seen yet?Vaani Kapoor's recent Instagram post gained attention from the Internet due to her uncanny resemblance to Katrina Kaif, leaving the Internet flabbergasted.

Renee Zellweger joins the cast of Only Murders in the Building Season 5American actor Renee Zellweger has joined the cast of Only Murders in the Building Season 5. The news was shared by the show's official social media handle.

Lee Dong-wook on The Divorce Insurance, jokes about alimony, co-stars South Korean actor Lee Dong-wook stars in The Divorce Insurance, a K-drama that presents a unique insurance concept for divorce, highlighting modern relationship dynamics. In an exclusive chat, the actor spoke about the show, his co-stars and more.

Hema Malini raises deepfake concerns in Lok Sabha: This cannot be taken lightlyActor and BJP MP Hema Malini addressed the Lok Sabha about the growing threat of deepfake technology, particularly its impact on celebrities. She emphasised the severe health effects on victims and called for serious attention to this issue.

Oscar-winning director Sean Baker reveals the inspiration behind AnoraAcclaimed director Sean Baker revealed the inspiration behind his latest film, Anora. The film, a collaboration with actor Karren Karagulian, delves into Russian-speaking communities and has won 5 Oscars.

Neha Kakkar on Melbourne concert: Organisers ran away with my moneySinger Neha Kakkar has shared a statement regarding her recently-held Melbourne concert. Kakkar was criticised for breaking down on stage and was booed at the venue after she arrived late.

Jr NTR floored by Japanese fan who learnt Telugu after watching RRRActor Jr NTR, on Thursday, shared a touching incident from Japan where a fan learned Telugu after watching his 2022 film RRR. Along with the video, he also highlighted the cinema's role in bridging cultures in the caption.

When Hayao Miyazaki called machine-made animation 'an insult to life'As Ghibli-style images are going viral, thanks to OpenAI's latest update, an old Hayao Miyazaki clip criticising machine-generated art resurfaced. In the clip, he called such art "creepy stuff" which is "an insult to life".

Empuraan box office: Mohanlal eyes Rs 50 crore opening, Mollywood's biggestMohanlal's L2: Empuraan hit theatres on March 27 worldwide amid massive anticipation. The film is expected to rake in over Rs 50 crore on its opening day, as per reports.
Scooby-Doo live-action series greenlit by NetflixWe have some good news for Scooby-Doo fans. The beloved cartoon is getting the live-action treatment by streaming giant Netflix.

Santosh director calls censor board's ban on film's release heartbreakingSantosh director Sandhya Suri reacted to the film's India being blocked by the censor board. This came after the board demanded extensive and widespread cuts.

Exclusive: Prabhas's team breaks silence on rumours of his weddingIt was rumoured that Telugu superstar Prabhas is finally settling down in life and that he was going to marry the daughter of a businessman. His team responded to the rumours regarding his marriage.

general news.headline: 3 cops killed in gunfight in J&K's Kathua, 2 terrorists shot deadThree policemen were killed, and two terrorists were gunned down in a gunbattle that broke out between them in Jammu and Kashmir's Kathua on Thursday.

Man kills wife in Bengaluru, stuffs body in suitcase, informs in-laws on callThe accused, Rakesh from Maharashtra, was tracked using call detail records (CDR) and detained by Pune police. The crime surfaced after the accused informed his wife's parents about the crime.

Immigration bill passed in Lok Sabha, Amit Shah says India not a dharamshalaUnion Home Minister Amit Shah said there were some people who wanted to enter India and create unrest, stressing that the country was not a 'dharamshala' and such individuals would be strongly dealt with.

Video: Mamata Banerjee pulls up image of 1990s attack when heckled during UK eventMamata Banerjee faced protests at Oxford University's Kellogg College, where audience members interrupted her speech with slogans and questions. In response, she held up a 1990s image of herself with a bandaged head.

Pikachu joins anti-Erdogan stir in Turkey, runs from police in viral videoAs the police attempted to disperse the angry protesters using water cannons, the activist was seen running in his Pokémon-themed costume to evade arrest in the early hours of March 27.

Indian student who self-deported hopes Columbia 'comes to senses', re-enrolls herRanjani Srinivasan never imagined her academic journey would lead to being labelled a 'terrorist sympathiser.' After her US student visa was revoked, Srinivasan deported herself. Now, she hopes that university will re-enroll her.

Message to India? Yunus jets off to China on Bangladesh Independence DayThe head of Bangladesh's interim government, Muhammad Yunus, chose to fly to Beijing on the country's Independence Day. A senior Bangladesh official called the visit a "message". A day earlier, PM Modi sent a message on "mutual sensitivity". What are the messages, and what do they convey?

Analysts have noted that the focus during today's trading session will be on upcoming tariff developments and the India-US trade deal outcome.

Adolescence creator Stephen Graham teases fans about Season 2Netflix's latest series Adolescence has taken the world by storm, topping charts in 80 countries. Creator Stephen Graham recently said how surprised he is by its global impact and also discussed its potential for a sequel.

Husbands being killed by wives: UP man who got wife married to loverBablu, who works as a labourer, arranged his wife Radhika's marriage to her boyfriend Vishal Kumar. Explaining reasons for the move, he said he was concerned for his safety after what happened in the Meerut murder case.

Rape convict Asaram Bapu's ashram land may be acquired for 2036 Olympics: SourcesThe land of Asaram Ashram, owned by jailed rape convict Asaram Bapu in Ahmedabad, may be acquired for organising the 2036 Olympics, which India has bidded for, sources told India Today TV.

Judge orders Trump administration to preserve Signal messages about Yemen attackA US judge on Thursday ordered the Trump administration to retain Signal messages about attack plans against Yemen's Houthis, which were accidentally shared with a journalist.

Want to join politics? Be ready to spend Rs 3-4 lakh every monthA new study reveals extensive pre-election expenses, sale of nominations and growing vote-buying, creating an 'oligarchisation of democracy' where money determines power

How will India's new Immigration Act stop illegal entryThe Immigration and Foreigners Bill, 2025, is aimed at regulating the entry, stay, and departure of foreigners in India. It replaces older immigration laws to make processes smoother and ensure national security, and it clearly defines the rights and responsibilities of both immigrants and authorities.
5 injured in stabbing attack in Amsterdam, suspect arrestedFive people have sustained injuries in a stabbing incident near Amsterdam's central Dam Square, and a suspect has been taken into custody.

Unsold at auction, Shardul Thakur reveals Zaheer Khan role in LSG comeback storyIPL 2025, SRH vs LSG: Months after going unsold in the mega auction, Shardul Thakur has made good use of the second chance that has come his way. The all-rounder took four wickets for Lucknow to stop the Hyderabad freight train on Thursday, March 27.

Cash row: Centre to decide on Justice Varma's transfer soon, say sourcesThe case file of Justice Varma has been received by the Centre and is under process along with some other recommendations of the Supreme Court Collegium that have been pending.

Asaduddin Owaisi on Waqf Bill: Every amendment is to destroy Waqf BoardAIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi slammed the proposed Waqf Bill, calling it an attempt to "destroy the Waqf Board" and strip Muslims of control over religious affairs.

sports.headline: CSK vs RCB preview: A grudge match in a rivalry of hype and passionIPL 2025 CSK vs RCB match preview: Chennai and Bengaluru renew their fiery rivalry in IPL 2025's first Southern Derby at Chepauk. While history favours Chennai, Bengaluru's emotionally charged win last year adds extra spice to this much-hyped showdown.

CSK vs RCB Playing XI Prediction: Will Bengaluru play an extra spinner?CSK vs RCB Playing 11, Chennai Super Kings vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru Prediction: Both teams will be looking to continue their winning momentum after beating KKR and MI earlier in the tournament.

Points Table, March 27: Lucknow Super Giants make big jump after SRH winIPL Points Table Update, March 27: From seventh, Lucknow Super Giants jumped to second after beating Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) by five wickets on Thursday at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium.

Chennai pitch, weather report: Will Bengaluru be able to cope with spin threat?CSK vs RCB, IPL 2025, pitch and weather report: Royal Challengers Bengaluru have travelled to Chennai for their second match of the season. After their triumph against KKR, will RCB be able to best the spin-trap in Chennai?

Dinesh Karthik backs Virat Kohli against spin, shares special Chepauk anecdoteIPL 2025: Speaking to the press on the eve of RCB's away game in Chennai, batting coach Dinesh Karthik downplayed concerns over Virat Kohli's ability to dominate spin. Kohli will face the spin trio of Noor Ahmed, R Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja at Chepauk on Friday.

Rishabh Pant quotes MS Dhoni lesson after LSG prove doubters wrong in HyderabadIPL, SRH vs LSG: Rishabh Pant's Lucknow Super Giants proved doubters wrong after a cilincal win against SunRisers Hyderabad on Thursday, March 27. After the win, Pant quoted a crucial lesson from his mentor MS Dhoni in the post match presentation ceremony.

All smiles as LSG owner hugs Rishabh Pant after big win in HyderabadIPL 2025, SRH vs LSG: Lucknow Super Giants owner Sanjiv Goenka gave Rishabh Pant a tight hug, praising him and his team for their triumph in Hyderabad. LSG thrashed the formidable SRH by 5 wickets, chasing 191 in just 16.1 overs.

MLB Opening Day: Juan Soto's Yankees debut, Paul Skenes faces Sandy Alcántara, and moreBaseball is back! Juan Soto steps up for the Yankees, rookie Paul Skenes battles Cy Young winner Sandy Alcántara, and Opening Day delivers must-watch matchups, thrilling debuts, and early-season drama.

Lord Shardul Thakur memes viral after LSG pacer decimates SRH 300 talksIPL 2025, SRH vs LSG: Shardul Thakur jolted SunRisers Hyderabad, taking two wickets in successive deliveries in the powerplay. He dismissed Abhishek Sharma and Ishan Kishan, who scored a hundred in their first match of the season.

IPL 2025: Past results don't matter, says Stephen Fleming ahead of CSK vs RCBIPL 2025, CSK vs RCB: Chennai Super Kings have a good head-to-head record against Royal Challengers Bengaluru, but head coach Stephen Fleming said the five-time champions will not look into the past results before their big game in Chennai on Friday, March 27.

Rishabh Pant in self-destruct mode? LSG captain trolled for bizarre toss callIPL 2025: LSG captain Rishabh Pant was trolled for his bizarre toss call against SRH at the Uppal Stadium in Hyderabad. Pant was called out by fans for the statements he made at the toss.

I will make Rohit Sharma run 20 km: Yograj Singh reveals India coach aspirationsFormer India cricketer Yograj Singh said he will ensure to get the best out of the likes of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma if he becomes the head coach of the Indian cricket team. Yograj lashed out at the criticism against the star batters, saying they are 'diamonds' who need to be taken care of.

NFL competition committee proposes replay, kickoff rule changesThe NFL competition committee has introduced proposals to modify replay reviews and kickoffs. If approved, the changes could impact game flow, strategy, and player safety in the upcoming season.

CSK vs RCB: Ruturaj Gaikwad talks up friendship with Rajat Patidar ahead of big clashIPL 2025, CSK vs RCB: As the hype builds up for the big-ticket contest in Chennai on Friday. CSK captain Ruturaj Gaikwad talked up his equation with new RCB skipper Rajat Patidar.

2025 World Figure Skating Championships: How to watch, full schedule, top competitorsThe best figure skaters from around the globe are set to come together for the 2025 ISU World Figure Skating Championships, happening from March 26-30 at TD Garden in Boston, Massachusetts.

2025 World Figure Skating Championships: How to watch, full schedule, top competitorsThe best figure skaters from around the globe are set to come together for the 2025 ISU World Figure Skating Championships, happening from March 26-30 at TD Garden in Boston, Massachusetts.

NFL: Russell Wilson says he'll start for Giants in 2025Newly signed QB Russell Wilson declares he will be the Giants' starting quarterback this season. With veteran leadership and championship experience, he's determined to take charge and lead the team to success.

KKR pitch controversy explained: Why are critics slamming Eden curator?All is not well at the Kolkata Knight Riders' home at the Eden Gardens. After just one match in Kolkata, tensions are flaring up between the side and Eden pitch curator Sujan Mukherjee. Here's everything we know.

IPL 2025: Hindi commentary under scanner, fans demand accountabilityThe standards of Hindi commentary in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) are being questioned by fans all over social media, who're openly expressing their displeasure over its quality.

NBA and FIBA explore European expansion: New league could feature top EuroLeague clubs, $500M franchise feesThe NBA (National Basketball Association) is making major strides toward expanding into Europe, with discussions about a new professional basketball league taking center stage at this week's Board of Governors meeting in New York.

NBA: LeBron James hits Buzzer-Beater to lead Lakers past PacersLeBron James maintained his streak of scoring 10 or more points in a game with a buzzer-beating last-second putback to give the Los Angeles Lakers a nail-biting 120-119 victory over the Indiana Pacers at Gainbridge Fieldhouse.

Virat Kohli really pushes you in the nets: Josh HazlewoodIPL 2025: Josh Hazlewood said that Virat Kohli tests a player's skills in the nets. Kohli made a brilliant start to his campaign after scoring an unbeaten 59 against Kolkata Knight Riders.

Vyshak reacts to Arshdeep's viral video: Happy that he had confidence in mePunjab Kings seamer Vijaykumar Vyshak reacted to Arshdeep Singh's viral video where he was seen suggesting Shreyas Iyer to bring him as an Impact player against Gujarat Titans.

Yuki Tsunoda to replace Liam Lawson at Red Bull from Japan Grand PrixYuki Tsunoda will make his debut for Red Bull at the Japanese Grand Prix next week, replacing struggling New Zealander Liam Lawson, who will be moved to the sister team Racing Bulls in a direct swap.

BCCI to decide India's future Test captain and central contracts at Guwahati meetingThe BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India) is all set to finalise the list of centrally contracted players and a future Test captain in a meeting scheduled to be held in Guwahati on March 29.

Rohit Sharma likely to opt out of England tour, Virat Kohli to retain spotSources told India Today that Rohit Sharma might not feature in India's upcoming Test series against England to be held later this year. But Virat Kohli is most likely to retain his spot.

Boxer Saweety, seen attacking husband in video, alleges he's interested in menIn a video on social media, boxer Saweety Boora said that her husband Deepak Hooda has an interest in men. In the video, the boxer broke down in tears, and she expressed her distress in tough times.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
